website_summaries.verdict: Has durability and features that are impressive for the affordable price. A lifetime warranty adds to the value.
pros: Features 12 components and offers similar tools as other models at about half the price
We give it high ratings for its locking system that keeps each tool in place for secure usage
cons: Some, such as the saw blade, are too small to be very effective

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as a Leatherman
customer_reviews.text: Having lost my second Leatherman, I decided to try a Gerber multi tool becasue of the lesser price ($34 vs. $110. The build is great, and the ergonomics fully addressed. That being said, here are the down sides: The knife blades are 2 1/2 inches long, which makes them virtually useless in a working or a survival situation. The other con is the nylon case, which is useless, as you cannot easily slide the multi tool into and out of it. otherwise, this is a very useful multi tool.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bruce Conway

customer_reviews.title: Good tool overall, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be sturdy and well constructed. Tool set is exactly what I want in a multi-tool. Tool lock release is a bit hard to use--will take a bit of getting used to I think, but it is not hard to figure out just a bit awkward. Pouch has inner pocket that gets in the way when trying to insert the tool into the pouch. Came in the most difficult packaging I have ever had to open!!!
customer_reviews.author: SD00001

customer_reviews.title: Smart Design. Gets the Job Done.
customer_reviews.text: The tool works great. I like that the tools open to the outside of the multi-tool. This is easier to access them. My only beef is the case ... it has a tiny pocket inside to hold 'survival instructions.' However, I always caught the tool on the pocket. Pain in the butt every time I wanted to put the tool away. I ended up cutting it out. Threw away the survival instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Gerber original
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this tool unlike the Gerber version lost one of the main screws quickly and became useless. My Gerber ones have lasted longer and are used daily. Since this is still Gerber I don’t get the quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: SplitRock Dozer

customer_reviews.title: Ya can't go wrong for the price...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Gerber quality at an awesome Amazon price! The ONLY reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it doesn't have a file... I guess that I got spoiled with my Leatherman... But at literally less than half the price, I'm not complaining. (Not too much, LOL) God bless and take care...
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hadjis

customer_reviews.title: ... TIME GETTING USED TO FOR ME BUT I AM PLEASED, ONLY WISH THE CARRIER WAS EASIER TO USE
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT SEEMS WELL MADE A BIT CLUMSY TO DETACH THE BLADES BUT IT MYAY TAKE SOME TIME GETTING USED TO FOR ME BUT I AM PLEASED, ONLY WISH THE CARRIER WAS EASIER TO USE, FOR THAT I WILL GIVE IT A 4
customer_reviews.author: skagman

customer_reviews.title: Overachiever!
customer_reviews.text: Read all the good reviews and i'm happy to report that they were all spot on. Besides the excellent price, the device is a multi tasking miracle; quick changes of knife to screwdriver, pliers to scissors - NO PROBLEM what so ever. Excellent ergo dynamic design, perfect weight and a spring-loaded jaw so you can keep going on with one hand without hassle. People were right about the sheath though, it has this little extra pocket thats useless but the tool itself is great so who's complaining. The best multitool I've owned - if you're in the market for one you can stop looking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeroen

customer_reviews.title: A Very Handy Multitool
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these, one for myself and one for my colleague to use at our office. It had the right amount of functionality for our needs. From both of our standpoints the only negative to them is the case, it doesn't seem to be a stiff or sturdy as our previous multitool cases. The interior pocket that I am assuming is for the fold out manual/pamphlet makes it more of a nuisance to try to slide the tool back into the case. We may cut our out to make life easier as we work up and down on ladders and etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley R. Clampitt

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've had other Gerber multi-tools in the past, and although I like this one it isn't the best one out there. The things I don't like are the can opener, the scissors, the Phillips screw driver (It's flat!) and the sheath. The biggest thing is the sheath. It has an additional pocket for the priorities of survival pamphlet that comes with it, but it makes putting the tool back into the sheath very difficult because the tool snags on it. If I were you I would go with a different Gerber model, or maybe even go with a Leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Pouch Velcro doesn't with
customer_reviews.text: Tool is great, but the pouch had low grade Velcro that didn't stick. I put in a sturdy snap from Joann Fabric and now it's secure.
customer_reviews.author: Tat Huen

customer_reviews.title: Overall great, some quality issues with repeated use
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with this at first. The blades were sharp and the extras are all in great very accesible spots. The carrying case is good, but wouldnt stand up to repeated use. Also you always have to take care when inserting the multitool as it easily gets snagged where the survival guide resides. After a couple of weeks my only gripe was that the spring actuating the scissor movement came out of the guide under the shear. I have to be careful of the amount of force I use and keep rebending it back under the shear. Other than that minor inconvenience, they are great as a back-up to other multitools or a reliable blade.
customer_reviews.author: F. Hermosillo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made to last, you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Built strong, best i have owned, (wish there was a leather case). Best ive found especially for the price. Well worth it, you can buy with confidence! Your only regret will be if you lose it
customer_reviews.author: Darrell mcneill

customer_reviews.title: great basic multitool
customer_reviews.text: This is a Suspension lightened slightly and with rubber gripping surfaces where the holes on the sides of the handle are on the Suspension. So all the same perks and problems. I think the Suspension is a great tool and have had two one stolen the other is now in my bug out bag, as I have a new Bear model. The case is small and barely held the Bear survival guide, (about the size of a watch warranty), and the tool. My old case still in good repair had lots of room for the tool and has a back pouch for the bit set.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Murrieta

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Bear Gylls Gerber knife, The spring loaded pliers are very useful and i am glad they finally put in this feature. Also i am very glad to see that all the tools are available outside so you never have to open it and the grip on the ultimate tool is a nice touch. It comes with a very nice sheath and bear grylls survival pocket guide. The only thing that got me worried was it looked like it was used but i got over it because i loved the sharp knives and precise needle noise.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rene Chacon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Multi function tools are so useful
customer_reviews.text: This tool is well built and sturdy. I'm very pleased with the value, and now that I have it, the quality. If you don't have a multi tool or you need a backup then you gotta get you one of these. I really like how it locks the tool in place and how well it is made. this can be an everyday carry or for emergencies only but it is well worth getting one or two.
customer_reviews.author: James Keith

customer_reviews.title: Just a "branded" multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found this tool particularly outstanding. Regular components, nothing to write home about. I agree, springed plyers are bettr than non-springed, and having tools vavilable from the outside can also be a minor convenience. Comparing to what I already had (a non-name el-cheapo one) it was essentially the same, bar a slightly better grip and the sheath. Bottom line: if you don't have a tool like that - it can be a decent purchase. If you already have something like that - spend your money elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai Sklobovsky

customer_reviews.title: not close to Original Gerber model
customer_reviews.text: I could have gotten used to opening like a Leatherman instead of the original Gerber; but other features caused me to return the item; I thought the jaws were more like Original Gerber than needle-nose Leatherman, but not ---and they won't even cut anything - back of jaws are a blunt match instead of being offset some as is required to cut; and trying to put the tool in the sheath and having the tool catch/hang everytime on the lip of the stupid no use pocket on the back inside of the sheath was very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: mwLaney

customer_reviews.title: A heavy muliti-tool
customer_reviews.text: I owned this mulit-tool for a while and then I gave it to my son. The main reason was it's weight. I found it uncomfortable when I wore it on my belt. Later I purchased the Gerber 31-001047 Bear Grylls Ultimate Survival Pack with Multitool, Flashlight, and Fire Starter, which I found a whole lot better. The tool has just as much as the 31-000749 Ultimate Milititool but a lot lighter. I recommend the 31-001047 over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Handy EDC item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I'd have some tools handy in my EDC backpack for work or just life. It seems of good build quality. There is a locking switch on each handle, so you can extend the knife or tool, then you need to disengage the lock to fold the tool back down. It comes in a durable cordura pouch with velcro flap. It seems a bit heavy, but that is likely due to solid materials. It is very handy to have in the pack for whenever it is needed. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I own 3. My daughter loves the locking of the blade, etc... And my son loves his.
customer_reviews.author: OptimusPrime

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the boyfriend because out of his many knives, he did not have the ever handy multi tool set. I'll admit, I was skeptical because of the Bear Grylls labeling and knew he would be too. I read many reviews and for my price range, this one was highly rated. I bought, he was and still is skeptical of the labeling but really does like it. It's very well made and for the price range, I highly recommend it. Sorry Bear...
customer_reviews.author: TLSK

customer_reviews.title: Fine for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I am excited about the tools that are included and the fact that all are accessible from the outside while it is folded. My only complaint is that the spring-action scissors are worthless - the blade slides right past the little spring wire that is supposed to hold tension on it. However, I am just as obsessed with purchasing scissors as I am about multitools, so there is always a pair around when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: liketoshop

customer_reviews.title: the tool is awesome i do not like the extra pocket in the ...
customer_reviews.text: the tool is awesome i do not like the extra pocket in the sheath it makes it difficult to get it holstered so i will probably look into another one had to give 5 stars for the tool itself though i had purchased a different brand before which was okay but was very stiff The tools accessibility is what i like most and the locking system as well Have always liked Gerber knives had an original Gator knife great quality form Gerber
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Mulcahy

customer_reviews.title: 2 years old and still works great, after a little TLC with CLR.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2 years. I keep it with my scuba diving gear and it has occasionally stayed soaked in salt water for days/weeks. It cleans easily with a little CLR and it back to like new. Great tools for keeping with my dive gear (though not during dives), on a boat, etc - when you don't want to be caught without a tool but don't need to be carrying a full toolkit either. Very surprised at its lifespan considering the amount of time it has spent in a bin covered in wet and salty gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Martinelli

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a lot of multi tools and knives...this one is one of the best. It has a very good design and good tools that do not go without use. The tools lock in place and the pliers have wire cutters on them too. Once the pliers are opened, it is spring loaded and very easy to use. These may cost a couple bucks more, but it is worth it...very good product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend item Next best thing to Leatherman And VictoriaKnox Swiss ...
customer_reviews.text: I recommend item Next best thing to Leatherman And VictoriaKnox Swiss army tools.. good for little pocket tool projects.. not good for major construction or major auto repair .. would not survive the harsh conditions
customer_reviews.author: Zhenman

customer_reviews.title: The tool for every purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade of my prior multipurpose tool. The last one quit on me; lesser quality than this. I love the feel and ease of use. One complaint, though. It is difficult to release the blade lock with one hand. I need to use both hands and this is not always convenient. This would probably not be an issue for people with good hand strength, but it is a down side for me.
customer_reviews.author: woose

customer_reviews.title: Great Gerber!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Gerber about a year ago and it has been great. The one this that I don't like is the case, there is a small pocket inside the case where the survival guide is supposed to go.. but when you try to put the Gerber back in the case it gets caught on it. So I just stopped using the case and put it in my pocket. But forget the case, the Gerber has been everything I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Matty Ice

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price its a great buy! Everything seems to work well except for the scissors. The spring doesn't always align to make the scissors work well. However its a good price point for what it is capable of doing.
customer_reviews.author: Moe A.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool the sheath isn’t made for everyday use !
customer_reviews.text: Love it only thing is the sheath after 2 weeks it’s coming apart
customer_reviews.author: Douglas  M

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to Bear and this gerber my wife and I have survived. We were hiking through the dense forests of midwest Ohio when a Grizzly bear came upon us. Grizzly tried to grab my wife, however I used the multitool in a sword like manner and stared the bear straight in the eye and forced him to retreat. I think that the gerber multitool was the only reason we live to this day as I locked my keys in the car and had to use the pliers to open the trunk to get into the car to get my keys.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bart

customer_reviews.title: Gerber BG, had to have one!
customer_reviews.text: Great multi tool. A bit fidgety like most, but really like the design and nylon handle. Its weighty but must be in order to do all it can do. Looks great but the pouch that comes in has 2 separate sleeves inside still wondering why as this just makes it hard or stressy trying to put it in the pouch again. Other than that, a great price on Amazon and can't complain too much still a great tool have used it alot and it does a really good job.
customer_reviews.author: BrKo

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Survival multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: What is not to like about this tool! It is a Gerber and all Gerber products have always done as I have asked of them. I will say that I purchased two of these and one was not sharp at all!! That was a first and it took a minute or two on the diamond stone to put a typical shave edge on the blade. Neal Kodiak, Alaska
customer_reviews.author: Neal Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a Present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my bf and I will say it gets way more use and handier than I expected. He has had this for about a week and he has used it daily around the house. Instead of searching for the screwdriver he pulled this out and used it cutting packages open instead of me looking for scissors he whipped it out. Awesome and works!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: complaining
customer_reviews.text: really not good. very bad metal. locke was broken in several days. screwdriver also was damaged soon
customer_reviews.author: davit

customer_reviews.title: good multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was a "deal of the day." I've owned cheap multi-tools in the past that rust and I throw them out but this one by far is the most well built. I like that the tool can lock; however I sometimes find it hard to unlock when my fingers are wet or sore because the unlock mechanism is so small. Some of the tools seem redundant but it's nice to have the assortment.
customer_reviews.author: RoBroKnos

customer_reviews.title: It's a Gerber!
customer_reviews.text: Well designed tool by Gerber. Bear who? Yeah, I know, but I bought this because it was a Gerber (a company known for building quality products), not because of the endorsement by Bear Grylls. I've had an all metal SOG for years, I have to say I find this Gerber a better design, SOG and Gerber are both quality tools. At $30 I find this a very good deal. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, the only thing I don't like is ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, the only thing I don't like is the button to unlock the tool you took out is hard to use. Say when you pull out the knife it locks into place( witch is very nice so it will not close on you when using) but that's the part am talking about. Its a release button to put it back in is hard to use. The tools them self are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi tool for the price...and more...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent multi tool for the price. The range of tools is better than many more expensive multi tools. I bought one of these for my son and one for my nephew and they are both very happy with them. One minor issue (not enough to drop the rating) is that it's difficult to fit the tool into the pouch with the "survival chart" in the second pocket. The grip on the toolis excellent, better than the metal grip on other Gerber multi tools. Even though it's made in China, there is less "play" in the tools when they're locked in place than some of the "made in USA" Gerber products I have bought previously.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Findlay

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: makes a great gift for daughter that drives good glove box item for travel etc
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Nice multi-tool, only reason for not giving it 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice multi-tool, only reason for not giving it 5 stars is the case it comes with, there is a little pocket inside for the survival tips paper that comes with it, that catches the multi-tool when trying to put it back in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-tool at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mulit tool. The knife was razor sharp right out of the package. The ergonomics are good and the price is low. My only complaints are that the holster is tight and the release buttons stick a bit. Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Caperton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful multi purpose tool.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool and extremely sharp! Make sure your knife blade is folded in before you try to open any other tools. Mine was out and my finger slipped while trying to open another tool and barely touch the blade but it cut a good slice in my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse

customer_reviews.title: he exclaimed "you did good! "
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bestie for Christmas. I don't know much about this kind of stuff, I just read reviews. But as soon as he opened it, he exclaimed "you did good!". Yay!! Many reviews said the only downside is that its a big heavy. My friend actually really likes the weight of it.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Abbott

customer_reviews.title: The best multi-tool I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This multi-tool is the best I have ever used. It is well made from very good steel. All the tools are on the outside and look in place! All the tools are very good quality and functional, and easy to open. They lock positively with no play. You can really put a lot of torque into the tools and they do not bend. This is another great Gerber product!
customer_reviews.author: Myron E. Cross II

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool, lousy pouch
customer_reviews.text: I've had many tools, this one is very good, (I miss having a file...) The Belt Pouch is TERRIBLE. I put a small wire tie around the top of the 'inner pocket' and that solved that part of the pouch problem. I like supporting one of the 'other' guys and price is great, just wish they had a better quality or even leather, pouch :(
customer_reviews.author: KSL

customer_reviews.title: Nice Piece
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived and I was very impressed with the craftsmanship in it. The price was amazingly low and the product is very high quality. My use will be to carry it in my tool bag for my motorcycle. It has many uses and I see it as a great addition to my tool kit. I would reccommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Joe

customer_reviews.title: OK but gets hung on pocket inside the pouch.
customer_reviews.text: The multitool has a lot of gadgets and most of them are useful. The knife is really sharp. It's very compact. I've used a Gerger tool similar to this for years. This one has more tools but is basically the same size. My only complaints are the pouch, when putting the tool into the pouch it gets hung up on a little inner pocket sewn into the pouch (this can be VERY annoying at times,) and the phillips screwdriver is useless. I went back to using my old Gerber multi tool.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES WARLICK

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping/hiking adventures
customer_reviews.text: It has every tool you really need out in the wilderness. The knife was already pretty sharp. The pliers work well and do not feel like cheap product (of course not as good as regular pliers due to the handle form factor). The best part about this multi-tool is the ability to lock the tool you want, which allows for great stability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Gerber...excellent as always
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as she needed a multi-tool for her work. A little big for her small hands but she says she loves it and it works great. Comfortable to grip and super high quality.
customer_reviews.author: lil'GTI

customer_reviews.title: The BEST multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several multi-tools for the men in my life over the years, and this is consistently the one they rave about and ask me where to get more so they can give them to their friends (and hoard to have one in every place they may need it!). It is very well constructed and is one-stop shopping for many everyday uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I bought it and love it. The only down side of this multitool ...
customer_reviews.text: As a Gerber & Bear Grylls fan, I bought it and love it. The only down side of this multitool that i received is the locking button is very stiff, you have to puch very hard just to close the tools and finger hurts. Other than that, it's a great tools to have.
customer_reviews.author: Sham Hoe Meng

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and great functionality. I particularly like the fact that some of the tools lock into place. This is a high quality product that I will have for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it is solid & a fine addition to my camp gear
customer_reviews.text: Where is the awl ? Other than that it is solid & a fine addition to my camp gear. Not for the ultralight hiker, but worth it's weight if ever needed...
customer_reviews.author: Brett B.

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and get at the tools. I like it that they are on the outside and they seem and look solid. I still have the old habit of reaching for my swiss army knife but I am glad the multi tool is there if I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken E. DooIt

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned other multi-tools and most of them sucked. I would say by far this is the best I have ever seen. This Multi-tool feels very solid and the knives are sharp and extremely functional. All of the tools lock when open all the way. Last but not least, the pliers are the best part, again, extremely functional.
customer_reviews.author: DJohnson

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome gerber tool
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome gerber tool. I love the size and the variety of knives. I do not like that the knives came dull and I had to use a knife sharpening stone to sharpen it right out of the package. Other then dull knives, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: What can I say its a Gerber
customer_reviews.text: Great product, exactly as described, and functionality is far superior to other multitools. Have had no rust issues or inability to get to a tool quickly. Now If I could just remember what pocket I put it in!. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Another great tool by Gerber !! I carry it in my bag every day​.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: Good quality multi-tool. I like the included carry pouch too.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T.

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable in the hand and all the tools you’ll ever need at a great price. This is a classic.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: My son is very happy!!
customer_reviews.text: It is a good quality and certainly has all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Excellent variant with so many uses
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed to work perfectly. Goes on every scouting outing. XD
customer_reviews.author: StoneHenge

customer_reviews.title: Required
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs a Gerber. I happen to share the same initials as Bear Grylls and that's the only reason I purchased this edition. It is however solid in its build, has a great tool lock and just enough tools to do anything I need it to. I carry it with me everywhere in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Gerber is the best!
customer_reviews.text: Ferber is by far the best for these tools. My hubby has had several in the past, but gerber lasts the longest! This one has a multitude of tools and comes with a nice case!
customer_reviews.author: Emily B.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic mutil use tool
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased as a gift, for my son who works with heavy equipment and pumps at a salt mine. He has been very pleased with the versatility and quality of this tool. It also came with a carrying case , he could slide onto his belt or place in the cab and likes that feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: juell

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: reat tool. I have owned one for over a year and it's the best quality multitool I have owned. Locking tools feature is great. Easy to recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good all around multi tool for the money. Has most everything I need. I keep one in my car console along with a lithium flashlight for emergencies. Nice and solid. The scissors aren't as good a design/quailty as on a Leatherman, but for the price it's a good deal. Fits the belt holster well too.
customer_reviews.author: djaco

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, but it's a little difficult to fold the various tools out, and sometimes hard to tell which one is which when they're all folded up. Overall a satisfactory purchase. Keeping it in the car for emergencies and we've used it several times already.
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: A+ quality tool
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this tool for over a year daily with no complaints! I am hard on my tools and it keeps coming back for more.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice tool, we got it for a friend for Christmas and he loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Manajeanette

customer_reviews.title: Well built brick
customer_reviews.text: I'd like this tool a lot more if it wasn't so bulky/heavy. It's well built and solid but honestly I feel it's just a lot heavier than it needs to be. All the tools are of high quality. Blades are sharp. Pliers work really well. Has no slip grippy siding and feels good in your hand. The frame just seems bulkier than is necessary which adds a lot to the weight. The bulk and mass were a surprise and let down for me. It all adds up when you're lugging a pack around...
customer_reviews.author: Senter Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try
customer_reviews.text: I have several survival type fold up tools. I just wanted to see if this one compares to my others. The price seemed awfully good for a Gerber product. Hope it does not rust like some reviews suggested. Somehow, in Arizona I doubt it will be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JimboBodine

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I had a gerber multi before that spent alot more for but lost it. Seems very rugged and durable. Lots of options with tool. Does not squeeze hand to close pliers to compact the tool like other gerbers so this is great concept. Not sure of sheath-not quite big enough.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: I'm surprised by the quality of craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.text: Being a "Bear Grylls" multitool, I was assuming a lesser quality of build but that is not the case. It feels sturdy and made with quality in mind. Purchased this while on sale and couldn't be more impressed, may purchase several more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ,and safe ,but the case ,could it come any cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: OPNY

customer_reviews.title: Seems great so far with no glaring issues
customer_reviews.text: Product is as advertised. Seems great so far with no glaring issues, but I haven't used enough to give a more extensive review. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: gqmalibu

customer_reviews.title: Bear Grills Tool
customer_reviews.text: This Bear Grylls tool was a Christmas gift for my husband and he absolutely loved it! It arrived very quickly and was still in its packaging and shipped with my invoice. Wonderful little tool I'd suggest for all Bear Grylls fans or anyone who loves camping in the wilderness! It's already come in handy several times and we haven't even gone camping yet!
customer_reviews.author: KaMaK

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Multitool
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Gerber to replace a Leatherman non-locking tool. While a little smaller, it has all the tools and will do just fine. I did put a sharper edge in the blade. All blades appear sturdy, thought I have not used them all. If your going to get one, just ensure that the smaller size meets your needs. It's quality is what I expected. I would buy another one if need be. .
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he LOVES it ! Everybody at work is always complimenting him on it and wants to know where to get one ! Needless to say, all of the features on it are awesome and work like a charm !! One of the best knives out !! A Must Have !!
customer_reviews.author: Madame

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for each of my sons, as birthday gifts. They are very solid and i like most of all that you don't have to open the pliers to get at the blades and such. I have an older Gerber that i love except for that one feature.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through about 7 to 10 multi-tools over the past few years. Some are cheaper than other, some more expensive but for the price this is the best multi-tool i've ever owned. Already left it out in the rain, no rust even after 2 months. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromy Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Great weight and great tools
customer_reviews.text: Great weight and great tools. I didn't care for pouch though; it has a partition so it makes it difficult to put the tool back in when finished using it.
customer_reviews.author: RM82

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tool. So useful and built for the long haul. Good steel which holds an edge or the print of the pliers or the Philips pattern on the screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L.

customer_reviews.title: ....not good.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this 5 stars. We're huge bear fans. But the screw driver broke after one use. From now on we'll stick to Leatherman and bear should stick to not making multitools.
customer_reviews.author: Okie Dokie

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a great multi-tool look no further
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all, this thing has locking knives and saws and is extremely easy to operate and comes with durable holster. Use it every day, hasn't failed me yet. Owned it for 4 years so far
customer_reviews.author: Raymond L. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Very nice - but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool - good quality - very useful tools. Only one strange problem with it that I keep thinking maybe I'm missing something: some of the tools like saw blade are nearly impossible to get out unless you have fingernails or something else to stick into the small space. Maybe there is some trick I haven't figured out yet.. I hope so, because otherwise its great.
customer_reviews.author: Ken R. Landis

customer_reviews.title: Solid Multitool for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It's $30 and it's made by Gerber. It's solid and the tools lock in place well. I have a Leatherman Micra that costs almost as much as this full size tool. I was really surprised by the high quality of this tool. I keep it in my car's glove compartment in case I need a multitool for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C Shubert

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Multitool
customer_reviews.text: I like that all the tools are accessable, minus pliers, without having to unfold the unit. All tools lock into position for safety. The pliers are spring assisted to open in the work mode. Thanks Bear Grylls and Gerber: good job on multitool and survival knife I purchased earlier.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great multitool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a gift. It has been really handy! Easy and comfortable to use. I have historically had issues closing pocket knives and multitools, but this was easy to figure out and easy to use while still being sturdy. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: audi

customer_reviews.title: Get help to open the packaging!
customer_reviews.text: You need a multi-tool to open the packaging of this multitool. I do like how the knives and be opened one handed. Nice grip, pliers are spring loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Meef

customer_reviews.title: Great little multitool
customer_reviews.text: after 3 years I still use it on at least a weekly basis weather I am installing cieling fans or tinkering in the garage. Great little multitool.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Gerber
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like having a Gerber. And there are lots of varieties of this device. This one is one of the most extensive. Always good to have on hand for all sorts of projects. Good Quality, well made, would recommend
customer_reviews.author: tada

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on multi-tool's before I picked to buy this one. I was debating between this or a leatherman. I simply picked this one because of the price and what I wanted on a multi-tool which were: straight and serrated edge knifes, scissors, screwdrivers, and pliers. The handle is not really rubberized, more like 1/3 rubberized, but that doesn't matter to me. Love the spring loaded pliers and scissors and the locking feature for all the tools. Very glad I picked this one instead of one that would have cost 2x or 3x more
customer_reviews.author: davidh1321

customer_reviews.title: over rated
customer_reviews.text: The used the scissor part of the set for about 4 times and it broke! the spring loaded part is out of place, so there's nothing to push it back in place. Also the pliers is already lose and I barley use it!
customer_reviews.author: synic

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, bad sheath
customer_reviews.text: The tool itself is made very well. It's pretty durable and the fold out tools don't wiggle like most multi-tools. That being said... The safety lock is a little hard to depress but I fixed that with a bit of 3 in 1 oil. The belt sheath that they give you is absolute junk though, the belt loop ripped off within 3 hours of wearing it. Pretty disappointing. But Im still recommending the tool itself.
customer_reviews.author: Garrie

customer_reviews.title: Top rayed functional Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased four of these for two sons and my two son's in law and they all loved them. I was disappointed in the Prime 2day delivery that took 8 days. I have had and loved the Gerber Suspension and this is an upgrade of that. excellent tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S. Wilcock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this item for fishing and it has everything I need in a nice size piece good quality you would expect from Gerber
customer_reviews.author: bryce moore

customer_reviews.title: Case is sorry
customer_reviews.text: I have used Gerbers for years. I have an old simple Gerber multitool more than ten years ols and the case is still fine. The belt loop on this case broke within three months. The multitool is fine but the case is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Sly Fox Hug

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool.  Easy to use, great features
customer_reviews.text: The best multitool I own. Has everything I need for a campout or long hike. The needle-nose pliers have srping action, which is a wonderful feaure. Feels good in the hand; sturdy, stable, compact. Perfect for scouters and outdoor enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

product_meta.title: Gerber Bear Grylls Ultimate Multi-Tool [31-000749]
product_meta.description:
Gerber Bear Grylls Ultimate Multi-Tool- With rugged construction, spring-loaded pliers, outboard locking tools, and an extra grippy handle, this is Bear Grylls's go-to survival tool. Containing 12 stainless steel, weather-resistant tools that lock while in use, this is a safe, reliable multi-tool to have in the wild.

AMAZON.COM
The product of collaboration between Gerber and survival expert Bear Grylls, the ultimate multitool provides 12 stainless steel weather-resistant components. Its rugged construction, spring-loaded pliers, external locking tools, and extra-grippy handle make this tool the ultimate multitasker no outdoor enthusiast should be without. The ultimate multitool comes with a nylon sheath.




The Ultimate MultiTool
At a Glance: * 12 stainless steel weather-resistant external components
   
   
 * Spring-loaded jaw for simplified one-handed use
   
   
 * Safe.T.Plus system locks components in usage position
   
   
 * Included military-grade nylon sheath is mildew resistant and lightweight
   
   
 * Comes with Bear Grylls' Priorities of Survival pocket guide and rescue instructions


The Ultimate Multitool features Gerber's Safe.T.Plus system, which locks components into their usage position.
View larger.
When not in use, this multitool folds down to 4 inches. View larger.Bear Grylls and Gerber Team Up
The ultimate multitool is part of the Gerber Bear Grylls Survival Series of gear. This collaboration brings together Gerber's 70-plus years of knife and gear expertise with Bear Grylls' extensive outdoor survival and adventure experience to create a one-of-a-kind line of knives, tools, and gear.From spending time in the British SAS to scaling Mount Everest, Bear knows what it takes to be a survivor in extreme situations and multiple environments. Now he brings that knowledge to the creation of a range of items that help you make the most of your outdoor adventures.

12 Components in a Single Compact Tool
The ultimate multitool lives up to its name by offering 12 components, including needle nose pliers, both fine-edge and serrated knives, a saw, a Phillips screwdriver, small and medium flat drivers, a lanyard ring, a bottle opener, a can opener, scissors, and wire cutters.

Lightweight, Comfortable Design
Lightweight and compact, with an open length of 6-3/10 inches, a closed length of 4 inches and an 8-4/5-ounce body, the ultimate multitool won't weigh you down. External components make for easy access, while a spring-loaded jaw provides simplified one-handed use. And thanks to the ergonomic textured-rubber grip, you'll enjoy maximum comfort without slipping.




Bear Grylls' Pocket Survival GuideSafety and Storage Features
As safe as it is practical, the ultimate multitool features Gerber's Safe.T.Plus system, which locks components into their usage position. A lightweight, military-grade sheath resists mildew as it protects the tool and makes it easier and safer to store.Includes Bear Grylls' Pocket Survival Guide
This tool comes with land-to-air rescue instructions and Bear Grylls' informative Priorities of Survival pocket guide, loaded with survival basics designed to help keep you alive until you can be rescued or rescue yourself.

What's in the Box
Multitool, nylon sheath, and pocket survival guide.





From the highest peaks of the Himalayas to the rainforests of South America, if world-renowned outdoorsman Bear Grylls is on an adventure you can be sure he's equipped with the most durable outdoor gear Gerber has to offer.
feature_bullets: Ergonomic textured rubber grip, maximizes comfort and reduces slippage
Spring-loaded jaw for simplified single-hand use
Patented Safe.T.Plus System, enhanced safety by locking components into usage position
Nylon sheath, lightweight, military-grade, mildew resistant and land-to-air rescue instructions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars860 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
